column4: HELP: I am running a Ubuntu on a live USB stick at the moment, and i have chrooted into my damaged ubuntu system. Now i need to apt-get install a package to (In theory) repair the damaged system. However when i use apt-get to try and install somethign i always get this error: 'Something wicked happend resolving *Various repositories* (-5 - No address associated with hostname)
what version are you running on this usb stick?
Is that the same as the installed system?
The one you're trying to fix?
Yeah, they are both on 10.10, i tried updating the repos but that just got a load more errors from each repo/mirror
Are you online on the live usb?  What did your chroot command look like?

Yeah i am connected to the net and browsing the web fine. And the chroot is like...: chroot "$middle" /usr/bin/env -i \ HOME=/root TERM="$TERM" PS1='\u:\w\$ ' \ PATH=/bin:/usr/bin:/sbin:/usr/sbin \ /bin/bash --login
Not all on one line thoguh XD
Pretty sure you can just mount the broken install's partition, and chroot that.
ah apt-get does work on the live stick but not on the chrooted part
mount /dev/sda1 /mnt    and then    chroot /mnt
yeah, have you tried recovery mode?  It's probably much easier than this
Just log in CLI and update / install your packages that way.  sudo apt-get install <packageName>
I just tried chrooting normally and i got the same issue
I suggest doing it CLI and avoid the whole chroot thing
I mean NO graphical output lol
Oh, like, blank screen?
It literally boots clicks and then just black screen even in recovery mode
nomodeset  ;)
tried that as well, i am an ATI customer XD
mmmm,  alright then chroot it is
Can you ping the repo servers listed in /etc/apt/sources.list
'ping: unknown host security.ubuntu.com/ubuntu
So the chrooted shell is not connected to the internet
